means: [地名] [保加利亚] 德拉戈曼

PerfectNetExp.abs: 译_百度百科 ... 译音[ transliteration] 译员[ interpreter;dragoman] 译者[ translator].

list.abs: ...充当了帮助他们完成交际的“中间体”(middleman, intermediary)（Hermann，1956/2002）。也有把这种人称为“舌人”(dragoman, truc…

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from obsolete French, from Italian dragomanno, from medieval Greek dragoumanos, from Arabic tarjumān 'interpreter'

means.word_mean: 1. an interpreter and guide in the Near East; in the Ottoman Empire in the 18th and 19th centuries a translator of European languages for the Turkish and Arab authorities and most dragomans were Greek (many reached high positions in the government)
